good try though.[/quote]

try changing if ((absX <= 2940) || (absX >= 3400) || (absY <= 3522) || (absY >= 3970)){

to

if ((absX <= 2940) && (absX >= 3400) && (absY <= 3522) && (absY >= 3970)){

if that doesnt work try checking out the coords

and i found another premade wild definition…

if(inWild()) { int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY; wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1); getPA().walkableInterface(197); if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) { if(inMulti()) { getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } else { getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } } else { getPA().multiWay(-1); getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199); } getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);

item.title: Very serious about getting help with this
item.dc:creator: @free_wayne free wayne
item.description:
@free_wayne wrote:

to be honest i’m not sure i even placed it in the right spot, is this my trading thing?
I tried putting it in a couple places just guessing.

[code]public class Trade implements PacketType {

@Override
public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
	int tradeId = c.getInStream().readSignedWordBigEndian();
	c.getPA().resetFollow();  
	
	if(c.arenas()) {
		c.sendMessage("You can't trade inside the arena!");
		return;
	}

if (inWild()) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t trade in the wilderness!”);
return;
}
if(c.playerRights == 2 && !Config.ADMIN_CAN_TRADE) {
c.sendMessage(“Trading as an admin has been disabled.”);
return;
}
if (tradeId != c.playerId)
c.getTradeAndDuel().requestTrade(tradeId);
else if (inWild()) {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t trade in the wilderness!”);
return;
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Very serious about getting help with this
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

[quote=“CreatorAlex, post:3, topic:356237”]I believe it needs to be

isinwild() == true

instead of

isinwild()

And by the way the isinwild boolean just needs to be

public boolean isinwild() {

not

public boolean isinwild(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {

It doesn’t have to be “isinwild() == true” because that is implied in the if statement.

As the for second part, that’s true, you don’t need all of those arguments for the method.

madgamer’s solution should work.

Read full topic
item.source: Very serious about getting help with this

item.title: Very serious about getting help with this
item.dc:creator: @free_wayne free wayne
item.description:
@free_wayne wrote:

First of all, let me start off by saying that I have been trying to do this for DAYS. Literally like 18 hours of nonstop attempts at making this work, I am determined to learn and understand this. I’ve messed around with it many times but I can’t get it to work…

What I am trying to do is remove trading from the wilderness on my [317] Server (Exion based)

I will seriously send you like 5$ or something paypal if you help me, if that’s what it takes to fix this shit.

Okay… I almost have it, I think.

I put this, in my client class.

    [code]public boolean isinwild(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
                    if ((absX <= 2940) || (absX >= 3400) ||(absY <= 3522) || (absY >= 3970)){                                     
    return true;
                    }
            return false;
    }[/code]

and this, in my trade method…

if(isinwild()) { c.sendMessage("You can't trade in the wilderness!"); return; }
But I still keep getting this error.

src\server\model\players\TradeAndDuel.java:34: cannot find symbol symbol : method isinwild() location: class server.model.players.TradeAndDuel if(isinwild()) { ^

Read full topic
item.source: Very serious about getting help with this
